Haemorrhoids are normal anatomical vascular structures of the anus. They are composed of dilated venous lakes, small arterioles or arteriovenous shunts, supporting tissue (smooth muscle fibres and collagen tissue) and a lining epithelium. They form a porto-systemic anastomotic system and are located in the upper part of the anal canal (internal haemorrhoidal plexus) or peri anal (external haemorrhoidal plexus).

question.question: What is the primary function of the anal canal?
question.option_a: Haemorrhoids are typically painful and cause discomfort when sitting
question.option_b: Haemorrhoids are a source of significant pain and are often treated with analgesics
question.option_c: Haemorrhoids are a type of prostate gland
question.option_d: Haemorrhoids are a type of cancerous growth
question.correct_option: Haemorrhoids are normal anatomical vascular structures of the anus
